**7. Applications in Pharmaceutical Formulation or Technology**
Sodium citrate, as either the dihydrate or anhydrous material, is widely used in pharmaceutical
formulations; see Table I. It is used in food products, primarily to adjust the pH of
solutions. It is also used as a sequestering agent. The anhydrous material is used in
effervescent tablet formulations.(1) Sodium citrate is additionally used as a blood
